title: 108_s2535
content: The Act titled "Medicare Preventive Services Coverage Act of 2004" allows coverage of additional preventive services deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The Medicare Preventive Services Coverage Act of 2004 expands coverage to include additional preventive services under the Social Security Act. The Medicare Preventive Services Coverage Act of 2004 expands coverage to include additional preventive services under the Social Security Act, as defined in subsection (bbb)(1). Section 1861 of the Social Security Act is amended to include these services. The Medicare Preventive Services Coverage Act of 2004 expands coverage to include additional preventive services under the Social Security Act. The Medicare Preventive Services Coverage Act of 2004 expands coverage to include additional preventive services, such as mental health services, determined by the Secretary to be necessary for prevention or early detection of illness or disability. The Secretary considers evidence-based recommendations and uses a national coverage determination process. Payment and elimination of cost-sharing are addressed in Section 1833(a)(1) of the Social Security Act. The Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003 is amended to include additional preventive services with 100 percent coverage. Coinsurance is eliminated in outpatient hospital settings. The Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003 is amended to include additional preventive services with full coverage. Coinsurance is removed in outpatient hospital settings. Amendments are made to include diagnostic mammography and additional preventive services in the Social Security Act. The Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003 is amended to include additional preventive services with full coverage in outpatient hospital settings. Amendments are made to waive deductibles for additional preventive services under the Social Security Act. Amendments to the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003 now include additional preventive services covered in outpatient hospital settings. Deductibles for these services are waived under the Social Security Act, with an effective date for services furnished after the enactment of the Act.
